description: A Condition Rule cannot already exist for the Reference or Description if the "Add Only" element is TRUE.

ProjectObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

ProjectObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

ProjectObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Project_Plan_Data.description: If Replace All is set to True, a full sync will be performed once the web service is submitted.

Project_Plan_Phase_WWS_Data.description: Flag indicating that the referenced data should be deleted.

validation.validation: If Delete is set to true, Replace All must be set to false.
validation.description: If Delete is set to true, Replace All must be set to false.

Project_Plan_Phase_WWS_Data.description: Phase ID.  This is the phase unique identifier.

Specifies the display order of the phase in the project plan.Specify the order using lower case letters.If the maximum number of child phases for a parent is less than or equal to 26, use one letter. Example: a, b, c ... z.If it is less than or equal to 676, use two letters. Example: aa, ab, ac ... zz.If it is less than or equal to 17576, use three letters. Example: aaa, aab, aac, ... zzz.

Specifies the display order of the task within the phase of a project plan.

Project_Plan_Task_WWS_Data.description: Task Start Date cannot be after Project End Date.
Task End Date cannot be after the Project End Date.

validation.validation: Task End Date cannot be before the Task Start Date.
This milestone task is associated to a contract.  Confirm that end date should be greater than today's date.

Project_Plan_Task_WWS_Data.description: Percent in decimal format, ex: enter 1 for 100%, .5 for 50%, etc
Indicates if the task is a project milestone.
Checking the task Closed will prevent any additional time to be reported for the specified task.
For informational purposes only to indicate that this project plan task qualifies for utilization calculations.
Free form text capturing comments about the task.

Financials_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Filename of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Encoding of the Attachment.
Boolean attribute identifying whether the Attachment is compressed.

validation.validation: If a file name is specified for a Financial Attachment, File Content and Content Type are required.

Project_Plan_Phase_WWS_Data.description: Contains task data that are grouped under a phase.

validation.validation: Milestone Flag must be on when the Task is currently in use as a Milestone.
Task End Date cannot be before the Task Start Date.
Project Task cannot be changed if the Project Plan Task is referenced as a Worktag.
Task Name can't be changed if the Project Plan Task has time entered.
End Date is required for contract milestones tasks marked complete.  See task [task].
The Project Plan Task ID: [id] is already in use by a different Project Plan Phase: [phase].
The Task ID: [id] cannot be used more than once.
Project Task Reference is required when creating a new Project Plan Task.
Non-Billable Flag cannot be updated on a Non-Billable Project.
Specify a valid Project Task ID. This ID is restricted to a different project hierarchy. Project Task ID:[id]
% Complete cannot be greater than 100%.
You must have a Reference ID for the project task when you update an existing project plan task.

Project_Plan_Data.description: Element Containing Project Plan Phase Data.

validation.validation: The Phase ID: [id] is already in use by a different Project: [project].
Project Phase Reference is required when creating a new Project Plan Phase for Project.
You can't change the parent of the project plan phase or project plan task: [phaseID].
Project Phase can't be changed if the Project Plan Phase or any of its descendant Project Plan Phases and Tasks is referenced as a worktag:  [phaseID].

The project plan phase either has child phases, or the phase, its child phases or tasks are associated with: timesheet entries, time blocks, contract milestones, resource forecasts, project-based service lines, or worktags. You can't delete this project plan phase: [phaseID].
You must have a Reference ID for the project phase when you update an existing project plan phase.

description: This is wrapper element for project plan data

validation.validation: Project Plan Template cannot be submitted when current phases/tasks are present
These tasks are associated with timesheet entries, time blocks, contract milestones, resource forecasts, project-based service lines, or worktags. You can't delete these project plan tasks: [tasks].
Specify a valid project plan phase. You specified a descendant as the parent of an ancestor, creating a circular reference in the phase hierarchy:  [phases]
These phases have an associated transaction or are used as a worktag. You can't delete these project plan phases: [phases].
